BBEX3.A.LTL.USD.CA.AC.A04: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Lithuania / USD 1 = LTL ... (middle) / up to 2014

General: The litas (LTL) was legal tender in Lithuania from 25 June 1993 to 31 December 2014. The temporary currency, the talonas (TAL), was converted to the litas at a rate of TAL 100 = LTL 1. From 1 April 1994 to 1 February 2002, the litas was pegged to the US dollar and from 2 February 2002 to 31 December 2014, it was pegged to the euro (EUR 1 = LTL 3.4528). Lithuania joined the euro area on 1 January 2015; irrevocable euro conversion rate: EUR 1 = LTL 3.45280.
Source: The Bank of Lithuania, Vilnius.
Methodology: Since 2002, calculated on the basis of mid-month and month-end rates.
Comment on 1995: Since 1 April 1994, the litas has been pegged to the US dollar at a rate of USD 1 = LTL 4.00.
Comment on 2002: On 2 February 2002, the litas ceased to be pegged to the US dollar and was pegged to the euro instead at a rate of EUR 1 = LTL 3.4528.
